sentences.en: Don't play the mischief with the cards I have arranged.
sentences.cn: 别把我理好的牌搞乱了.

sentences.en: He who is disposed for mischief will never want occasion.
sentences.cn: 存心要使坏,不怕没机会.

sentences.en: Her eyes were full of mischief.
sentences.cn: 她的眼睛里充满了调皮的神情.

sentences.en: His eyes were full of mischief.
If you can’t see Nick, you can be sure he’s up to some mischief (= behaving badly and causing trouble or damage ) .
sentences.cn: 要是看不到尼克，就可以肯定他又在捣什么鬼了。

sentences.en: If you try to lift that box, you’ll do yourself a mischief.
sentences.cn: 你要是想搬那个箱子，会伤着自己的。

sentences.en: James Fox is best known as the author of White Mischief.
sentences.cn: 詹姆斯·福克斯以《欲望城》一书最为出名.

sentences.en: Now run along, and don’t get into mischief .
She was always making mischief between them.
sentences.cn: 她总是在他们之间拨弄是非.

sentences.en: The boys are brewing some mischief.
The mischief arose from irresponsible gossip.
sentences.cn: 这种不幸的事是因无聊的闲话而引起的.

sentences.en: The mischief is that he did it without permission.
sentences.cn: 错处就在他做这事末经许可.
这场暴风雨造成了巨大的损害.

sentences.en: They’ve got enough toys to keep them out of mischief for a while.
sentences.cn: 他们有足够的玩具玩，暂时不会捣蛋。

sentences.en: Those children are always getting into mischief .
Who set him on to do this piece of mischief?
sentences.cn: 是谁唆使他去做这件害人的事?

trans.tran_cn: 损害，危害，顽皮，淘气，恶作剧，祸根
trans.tran_en: bad behaviour, especially by children, that causes trouble or damage, but no serious harm
